query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
1 Guardando nel suo Figlio con l’Amore 2 che l’uno e l’altro etternalmente spira, 3 lo primo e ineffabile Valore
query.result: 1 Looking in his Son with the Love 2 that the one and the other eternally breathe, 3 the first and ineffable Value

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
4 quanto per mente e per loco si gira 5 con tant’ ordine fé, ch’esser non puote 6 sanza gustar di lui chi ciò rimira.
query.result: 4 as much as turns through mind and through space 5 with so much order made, that it cannot be 6 without tasting of him who gazes on it.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
7 Leva dunque, lettore, a l’alte rote 8 meco la vista, dritto a quella parte 9 dove l’un moto e l’altro si percuote;

Please translate each line literally into English.
10 e lì comincia a vagheggiar ne l’arte 11 di quel maestro che dentro a sé l’ama, 12 tanto che mai da lei l’occhio non parte.
query.result: 10 and there begin to gaze upon the art 11 of that master who loves it within himself, 12 so much that his eye never departs from it.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
13 Vedi come da indi si dirama 14 l’oblico cerchio che i pianeti porta, 15 per sodisfare al mondo che li chiama.
query.result: 13 See how from there branches out 14 the oblique circle that carries the planets, 15 to satisfy the world that calls to them.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
16 Che se la strada lor non fosse torta, 17 molta virtù nel ciel sarebbe in vano, 18 e quasi ogne potenza qua giù morta;

Please translate each line literally into English.
19 e se dal dritto più o men lontano 20 fosse ’l partire, assai sarebbe manco 21 e giù e sù de l’ordine mondano.
query.result: 19 and if their departure from the straight line 20 were more or less, there would be much less 21 both above and below of the world's order.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
22 Or ti riman, lettor, sovra ’l tuo banco, 23 dietro pensando a ciò che si preliba, 24 s’esser vuoi lieto assai prima che stanco.
query.result: 22 Now remain, reader, upon your bench, 23 reflecting on what has been foretasted, 24 if you wish to be joyful long before you are weary.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
25 Messo t’ho innanzi: omai per te ti ciba; 26 ché a sé torce tutta la mia cura 27 quella materia ond’ io son fatto scriba.

Please translate each line literally into English.
28 Lo ministro maggior de la natura, 29 che del valor del ciel lo mondo imprenta 30 e col suo lume il tempo ne misura,
query.result: 28 The greatest minister of nature, 29 who imprints the world with the power of heaven 30 and with his light measures time for it,

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
31 con quella parte che sù si rammenta 32 congiunto, si girava per le spire 33 in che più tosto ognora s’appresenta;

Please translate each line literally into English.
34 e io era con lui; ma del salire 35 non m’accors’ io, se non com’ uom s’accorge, 36 anzi ’l primo pensier, del suo venire.
query.result: 34 and I was with him; but I did not notice the ascent, 35 except as a man notices, before the first thought, 36 the arrival of his own thought.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
37 È Bëatrice quella che sì scorge 38 di bene in meglio, sì subitamente 39 che l’atto suo per tempo non si sporge.
query.result: 37 It is Beatrice who thus leads me 38 from good to better, so suddenly 39 that her action does not extend itself in time.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
40 Quant’ esser convenia da sé lucente 41 quel ch’era dentro al sol dov’ io entra’mi, 42 non per color, ma per lume parvente!
query.result: 40 How self-luminous must that have been 41 which was within the sun where I entered, 42 not apparent by color, but by light!

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
43 Perch’ io lo ’ngegno e l’arte e l’uso chiami, 44 sì nol direi che mai s’imaginasse; 45 ma creder puossi e di veder si brami.

Please translate each line literally into English.
46 E se le fantasie nostre son basse 47 a tanta altezza, non è maraviglia; 48 ché sopra ’l sol non fu occhio ch’andasse.

Please translate each line literally into English.
49 Tal era quivi la quarta famiglia 50 de l’alto Padre, che sempre la sazia, 51 mostrando come spira e come figlia.
query.result: 49 Such was the fourth family here 50 of the high Father, who always satisfies it, 51 showing how it breathes forth and how it is his daughter.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
52 E Bëatrice cominciò: «Ringrazia, 53 ringrazia il Sol de li angeli, ch’a questo 54 sensibil t’ha levato per sua grazia».
query.result: 52 And Beatrice began: "Give thanks, 53 give thanks to the Sun of the angels, who by his grace 54 has lifted you up to this sensible thing."

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
55 Cor di mortal non fu mai sì digesto 56 a divozione e a rendersi a Dio 57 con tutto ’l suo gradir cotanto presto,
query.result: 55 Never was the heart of a mortal 56 so disposed to devotion and to surrendering itself to God 57 with all its gratitude so promptly,

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
58 come a quelle parole mi fec’ io; 59 e sì tutto ’l mio amore in lui si mise, 60 che Bëatrice eclissò ne l’oblio.

Please translate each line literally into English.
61 Non le dispiacque; ma sì se ne rise, 62 che lo splendor de li occhi suoi ridenti 63 mia mente unita in più cose divise.
query.result: 61 It did not displease her; but she laughed at it so, 62 that the radiance of her laughing eyes 63 divided my mind, which was intent on many things.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
64 Io vidi più folgór vivi e vincenti 65 far di noi centro e di sé far corona, 66 più dolci in voce che in vista lucenti:
query.result: 64 I saw more living and conquering lightnings 65 making a center of us and a crown of themselves, 66 sweeter in voice than they were shining in appearance:

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
67 così cinger la figlia di Latona 68 vedem talvolta, quando l’aere è pregno, 69 sì che ritenga il fil che fa la zona.
query.result: 67 thus we sometimes see the daughter of Latona encircled, 68 when the air is pregnant, 69 so that it retains the thread that forms the halo.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
70 Ne la corte del cielo, ond’ io rivegno, 71 si trovan molte gioie care e belle 72 tanto che non si posson trar del regno;

Please translate each line literally into English.
73 e ’l canto di quei lumi era di quelle; 74 chi non s’impenna sì che là sù voli, 75 dal muto aspetti quindi le novelle.

Please translate each line literally into English.
76 Poi, sì cantando, quelli ardenti soli 77 si fuor girati intorno a noi tre volte, 78 come stelle vicine a’ fermi poli,
query.result: 76 Then, singing thus, those burning suns 77 turned around us three times, 78 like stars close to the fixed poles,

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
79 donne mi parver, non da ballo sciolte, 80 ma che s’arrestin tacite, ascoltando 81 fin che le nove note hanno ricolte.
query.result: 79 they seemed to me to be ladies, not released from a dance, 80 but who stand still, listening in silence, 81 until they have gathered the new notes.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
82 E dentro a l’un senti’ cominciar: «Quando 83 lo raggio de la grazia, onde s’accende 84 verace amore e che poi cresce amando,
query.result: 82 And within one I heard begin: "When 83 the ray of grace, from which true love is kindled 84 and which then grows by loving,

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
85 multiplicato in te tanto resplende, 86 che ti conduce su per quella scala 87 u’ sanza risalir nessun discende;

Please translate each line literally into English.
88 qual ti negasse il vin de la sua fiala 89 per la tua sete, in libertà non fora 90 se non com’ acqua ch’al mar non si cala.
query.result: 88 whoever denied you the wine of his flask 89 for your thirst would not be free 90 except as water that does not flow down to the sea.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
91 Tu vuo’ saper di quai piante s’infiora 92 questa ghirlanda che ’ntorno vagheggia 93 la bella donna ch’al ciel t’avvalora.
query.result: 91 You want to know with what plants is adorned 92 this garland that encircles and beautifies 93 the fair lady who gives you strength for heaven.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
94 Io fui de li agni de la santa greggia 95 che Domenico mena per cammino 96 u’ ben s’impingua se non si vaneggia.
query.result: 94 I was one of the lambs of the holy flock 95 that Dominic leads along the path 96 where one grows fat if one does not stray.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
97 Questi che m’è a destra più vicino, 98 frate e maestro fummi, ed esso Alberto 99 è di Cologna, e io Thomas d’Aquino.
query.result: 97 This one who is closest to me on the right, 98 was my brother and teacher, and he is Albert 99 of Cologne, and I am Thomas Aquinas.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
100 Se sì di tutti li altri esser vuo’ certo, 101 di retro al mio parlar ten vien col viso 102 girando su per lo beato serto.
query.result: 100 If you wish to be certain of all the others, 101 follow my words with your gaze, 102 turning around through the blessed garland.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
103 Quell’ altro fiammeggiare esce del riso 104 di Grazïan, che l’uno e l’altro foro 105 aiutò sì che piace in paradiso.
query.result: 103 That other flaming issues from the smile 104 of Gratian, who aided both the one and the other forum 105 so that he is pleasing in paradise.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
106 L’altro ch’appresso addorna il nostro coro, 107 quel Pietro fu che con la poverella 108 offerse a Santa Chiesa suo tesoro.
query.result: 106 The other who next adorns our choir, 107 was that Peter who with the poor widow 108 offered his treasure to Holy Church.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
109 La quinta luce, ch’è tra noi più bella, 110 spira di tale amor, che tutto ’l mondo 111 là giù ne gola di saper novella:
query.result: 109 The fifth light, which is most beautiful among us, 110 breathes forth such love that the whole world 111 down there thirsts to know news of it:

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
112 entro v’è l’alta mente u’ sì profondo 113 saver fu messo, che, se ’l vero è vero, 114 a veder tanto non surse il secondo.
query.result: 112 within it is the lofty mind in which such profound 113 knowledge was placed, that if the truth is true, 114 no second has risen to see so much.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
115 Appresso vedi il lume di quel cero 116 che giù in carne più a dentro vide 117 l’angelica natura e ’l ministero.
query.result: 115 Next you see the light of that candle 116 who down below in the flesh saw most deeply 117 the angelic nature and its ministry.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
118 Ne l’altra piccioletta luce ride 119 quello avvocato de’ tempi cristiani 120 del cui latino Augustin si provide.
query.result: 118 In the other little light smiles 119 that advocate of Christian times 120 from whose Latin Augustine provided himself.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
121 Or se tu l’occhio de la mente trani 122 di luce in luce dietro a le mie lode, 123 già de l’ottava con sete rimani.
query.result: 121 Now if you transfer the eye of your mind 122 from light to light following my praises, 123 you already thirst for the eighth.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
124 Per vedere ogne ben dentro vi gode 125 l’anima santa che ’l mondo fallace 126 fa manifesto a chi di lei ben ode.
query.result: 124 To see every good within it rejoices 125 the holy soul who makes the deceitful world 126 manifest to whoever listens well to her.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
127 Lo corpo ond’ ella fu cacciata giace 128 giuso in Cieldauro; ed essa da martiro 129 e da essilio venne a questa pace.
query.result: 127 The body from which she was expelled lies 128 below in Cieldauro; and she from martyrdom 129 and from exile came to this peace.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
130 Vedi oltre fiammeggiar l’ardente spiro 131 d’Isidoro, di Beda e di Riccardo, 132 che a considerar fu più che viro.
query.result: 130 See beyond, flaming with ardent breath, 131 Isidore, Bede, and Richard, 132 who in contemplation was more than a man.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
133 Questi onde a me ritorna il tuo riguardo, 134 è ’l lume d’uno spirto che ’n pensieri 135 gravi a morir li parve venir tardo:
query.result: 133 This one from whom your gaze returns to me, 134 is the light of a spirit who in grave 135 thoughts seemed to come late to dying:

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
136 essa è la luce etterna di Sigieri, 137 che, leggendo nel Vico de li Strami, 138 silogizzò invidïosi veri».
query.result: 136 it is the eternal light of Siger, 137 who, reading in the Rue du Fouarre, 138 syllogized envious truths."

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
139 Indi, come orologio che ne chiami 140 ne l’ora che la sposa di Dio surge 141 a mattinar lo sposo perché l’ami,
query.result: 139 Then, like a clock that calls us 140 at the hour when the bride of God rises 141 to sing matins to the bridegroom so that he may love her,

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
142 che l’una parte e l’altra tira e urge, 143 tin tin sonando con sì dolce nota, 144 che ’l ben disposto spirto d’amor turge;

Please translate each line literally into English.
145 così vid’ ïo la gloriosa rota 146 muoversi e render voce a voce in tempra 147 e in dolcezza ch’esser non pò nota
query.result: 145 thus I saw the glorious wheel 146 move and render voice to voice in a harmony 147 and in a sweetness that cannot be known

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
148 se non colà dove gioir s’insempra.
query.result: 148 except there where joy is sempiternal.
